prompt: Write a poem about underpass echo in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem. Keep ballad rhyme (ABAB/ABCB) and a lively alternating cadence. Invent new coinages in each stanza and introduce a named creature. Add onomatopoeia and some alliteration. Arc: warning → preparation → encounter/slay → return/celebration. Echo the opening at the end. Avoid verbatim lines; limit canonical words.
poem:
Underpass Echo and the Hollowhound

Hush—heed the underpass echo,
my curb-born kin, take care;
Where dripdrab lights go slow blink-o,
and rumblevans snare air.

I strapped my clangblade tight, click-clack,
and lantern glooms-a-glow;
With skidshoe soles and shim-sham pack,
for graffisheen below.

Skrree! went rails; the Hollowhound deep
uncoiled from tunnel throat;
Its echojaw sang basement-deep,
with boom-bap, boat-horn note.

I whirled the rumbleblade—whish, whap!
it snap-snarled, skulked, and sprang;
Through dripstone drip it took the rap,
ka-CHUNK! the clangblade sang.

Back home through hum-tide underpass
we jing-janged cups of cheer;
The curbfolk crowned my clatterclass,
skirr-skatter, bright and clear.

Hush—hark the underpass echo,
now soft as summer air;
Where dripdrab lamps still wink blink-o,
and hush-wheels spare the air.
label: high

prompt: Write a poem about morning fog in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem. Keep ballad rhyme (ABAB/ABCB) and a lively alternating cadence. Echo the opening at the end. Avoid verbatim lines; limit canonical words.
poem:
The Mizzlewump of Mufflemorn

In mufflemorn the mists went mewl,
Hush-hush along the lane,
They swithered hedge and heather-cool—
Heed Mizzlewump, fogbane!

I buckled up my bluster-coat,
Clink-clack my whickerblade;
A foglamp-gleam I gripped to smote,
And mizzle-crumbs I laid.

Out whoofled then the Mizzlewump,
Skreek-scritch through milkish gloom;
Its foghorn maw went murgle-thump—
A shudder-censered doom.

I feinted through the fuddlefloe,
Whish-whack, the steellet sang;
Then cleft its clouded collar-bow—
Krak-krak, a muffled clang.

Back breezebound through the bramble-lane,
Ring-ding the village bell;
We twirled a tune of dewbright gain—
Ding-dong, the kettles swell.

In mufflemorn the mistlume mewls,
Hush-hush beside the lane;
It swathers hedge and heather-swoon—
Yet Mizzlewump lies slain.
label: high

prompt: Write a poem about déjà vu in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem. Keep ballad rhyme (ABAB/ABCB) and a lively alternating cadence. Echo the opening at the end. Avoid verbatim lines; limit canonical words.
poem:
The Vuwhirl and the Vu-Drake

Blue dusk went blimmer round the lane,
Mind-twitchers, all—beware;
Tick-tock repeats the weary brain,
The vuwhirl's mirror snare.

I buckled on my everedge,
My kit of quick-prepare;
With recall-coil and memling badge,
Clink-clack the cautious care.

From loopwood loomed the Vu-Drake grim,
It hissed a hushy flare;
Dé-jing its déja-lanterns brim,
Whirr-whirr through twinning air.

I feinted through its foldagain,
Ka-ching! the everedge there;
The reverb-soul unspooled its chain,
Swish-swash! blue sparks flew there.

It reeled, the Vu-Drake vu-did twice,
Thunk-thud its whinchered hide;
I clove its clocky countermind,
The loopling horror died.

Blue dusk still blimmer round the lane,
No twice-time need beware;
We clap the clocks and quaffagain,
The vuwhirl thins to air.
label: high

poem:
The Wishworn Way and the Whimblewyrm

Beware the wishworn wander-way,
the mossmuttered dim lane,
Where hedgehush warns, desire-path 'Stay'
and sly-sedge sips your brain.

I packed a pocket strideblade bright,
with thrum-thrum courage bread,
A lamp of pathluck, tinder-light,
and maplet-twine for thread.

The wishtrack winked through thorny rust,
a hush-hush foxfire seam,
It swish-said, step, surrender trust,
and sip the shortcut dream.

Out skirr-skurr slid the Whimblewyrm,
with briar-breath that burns,
Its belly-bell rang squirm-squirm-squirm,
and wickwinded the ferns.

I raised my strideblade—clack!—to throw,
the thicket thundered back,
Zap-zing the wishtrack spat a glow,
my stepspell held the crack.

I spun; the Whimblewyrm dropped down,
with muckmire-smacking tail,
I thunk-thrust true; its briar-crown
went whumph into the vale.

Back beat my boots along the loam,
the hedges hissed hooray,
Ding-dong the pathheart drummed me home,
through glee-bright bramble-spray.

Bewary be of wishworn way,
that mossmurmurs low,
Yet those who stride with swing and sway,
and hush the hedges slow.
label: high

poem:
Ballad of the Mumblegrind in Room B

In buzz-lit rooms where tickers click,
the hushling hours all loom;
Fluoresk chairs shush; the metrics click,
and Mumblegrind will bloom.

I donned my noteflake jacket tight
with caffeinhelm agleam;
A clicker-sabre, slick and bright,
and stratishield of scheme.

I mapped the gantlet of the slide
by ping and paper-pleat;
With incantagenda to guide,
and tempo-tapped my feet.

Through screen-door shade came rumble-doom—
ka-thrum, the speakers boomed;
The Mumblegrind, with jargon-plume,
long memodrool perfumed.

It droned “uh-uh” and “tsk-tsk-tsk”;
the binders flapped and shook;
I thrust my pointer-lance—zap whisk!
and crossed its mumblebook.

Skritch-skrat the whiteboard markers sang,
ker-chunk, the swivel swore;
My laser-pointer-lance went bang,
it fell to meeting-floor.

The coffeestreamers chimed cha-ching,
the staffers whooped in glee;
We high-five-fanfared zing-zing-zing,
and set the minutes free.

In buzz-lit rooms where tickers click,
now bright-eyed briefers zoom;
Fluoresk chairs hush; notions click,
no Mumblegrind of gloom.
label: high
